reactor.core.dispatch

Class RingBufferDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.core.dispatch.AbstractLifecycleDispatcher
      • reactor.core.dispatch.SingleThreadDispatcher
        • reactor.core.dispatch.RingBufferDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor, WaitingMood, Dispatcher, Resource

    public final class RingBufferDispatcher
extends SingleThreadDispatcher
implements WaitingMood
    Implementation of a Dispatcher that uses a RingBuffer to queue tasks to execute.
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

    • Constructor Detail

      • RingBufferDispatcher

        public RingBufferDispatcher(String name)
        Creates a new RingBufferDispatcher with the given name. It will use a RingBuffer with 1024 slots, configured with a producer type of MULTI and a blocking wait strategy.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the dispatcher.

      • RingBufferDispatcher

        public RingBufferDispatcher(String name,
                            int bufferSize)
        Creates a new RingBufferDispatcher with the given name and , configured with a producer type of MULTI and a blocking wait strategy.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the dispatcher
        bufferSize - The size to configure the ring buffer with

      • RingBufferDispatcher

        public RingBufferDispatcher(String name,
                            int bufferSize,
                            Consumer<Throwable> uncaughtExceptionHandler)
        Creates a new RingBufferDispatcher with the given name. It will use a RingBuffer with bufferSize slots, configured with a producer type of MULTI and a blocking wait. A given @param uncaughtExceptionHandler will catch anything not handled e.g. by the owning reactor.bus.EventBus or reactor.rx.Stream.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the dispatcher
        bufferSize - The size to configure the ring buffer with
        uncaughtExceptionHandler - The last resort exception handler

      • RingBufferDispatcher

        public RingBufferDispatcher(String name,
                            int bufferSize,
                            Consumer<Throwable> uncaughtExceptionHandler,
                            reactor.jarjar.com.lmax.disruptor.dsl.ProducerType producerType,
                            reactor.jarjar.com.lmax.disruptor.WaitStrategy waitStrategy)
        Creates a new RingBufferDispatcher with the given name. It will use a RingBuffer with bufferSize slots, configured with the given producerType, and waitStrategy. A null will make this dispatcher logging such exceptions.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the dispatcher
        bufferSize - The size to configure the ring buffer with
        producerType - The producer type to configure the ring buffer with
        waitStrategy - The wait strategy to configure the ring buffer with
        uncaughtExceptionHandler - The last resort exception handler

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this active Resource such that it can no longer be used. If the resource carries any work, it will wait for all the remaining tasks to perform before closing the resource.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Resource
        Overrides:
        shutdown in class AbstractLifecycleDispatcher

      • forceShutdown

        public void forceShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this Resource, forcibly halting any work currently executing and discarding any tasks that have not yet been executed.
        Specified by:
        forceShutdown in interface Resource
        Overrides:
        forceShutdown in class AbstractLifecycleDispatcher

      • remainingSlots

        public long remainingSlots()
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Request the remaining capacity for the underlying shared state structure. E.g. RingBufferDispatcher will return RingBuffer.remainingCapacity().

        Specified by:
        remainingSlots in interface Dispatcher
        Returns:
        the remaining capacity if supported otherwise it returns a negative value.

        Description copied from interface: WaitingMood
